result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin A Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber for work and looking for work.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $733.01. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with the Stevens Point Kmart.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Pay the outstanding balance due on 07CF395 which is $1,149.00. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge unless it has already been done. 
If successfully completes, Court will grant early discharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Alvin A Anderson in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drury makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
- Imposed & Stayed - 180 days jail with huber for work and looking for work. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
No contact with Stevens Point Kmart.
Pay restitution in the amount of $733.01 .
Pay costs. 
Pay the outstanding balance due on 07CF395 which is $1,149.00.
If successfully completes, Court will grant early Discharge. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge unless it has already been done. 

The warrant on 07CF395 is ordered vacated.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued.

Defendant Alvin A Anderson in court with attorney Sean Patrick Drury. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.
